text: #TRdl Tretq TTHNf  xifuan<ut Taq Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 {I (ner 4aev &1 TTHT T7T4) 4RR Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 #1 <1 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) 4-5 g 6, #7er-10, ERrGT, T ferf-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka; New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/218/2007-Admn Dated: 21.11,2013 Policy Matter-Technical (143/2013) (Decision takenin 59th meeting of the Executive Committee held on 2Ls' August 2013vide Agenda Item NoI) Sub: Review of Foreign Currency component as a part of Financial proposal; Some Supervision Consultancy and EPC works have & foreign currency component. The recent currency fluctuations have created uncertainity as regards the final cost of the projects. The need for curtailment of foreign currency expenses and,minimizing the uncertainities aS regards the final cost of the projects was discussed in the meeting of the Executive Committee held on 21s1 August 2013 and it was decided that: i) For all future Consultancy and EPC projects, the offers shall be received only in Indian currency without any foreign currency component: ii) For Consultancy and EPC projects, where bids have been received but the work is to be awarded, the quote of foreign currency of the successful bidder may be renegotiated and settled as per the exchange rate prevailing on the bid due date. The work be awarded only thereafter: 2 This issueswith the approval of Competent Authority. (S.P.
